DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Study Protocol Contact Person Role Code RoleType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A person acting as a channel for communication on behalf of a group._The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.:A system, often of numbered categories, used for representation of data._The code that represents the value for the state of a structural role.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Study Protocol Contact Person Role Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A person acting as a channel for communication on behalf of a group._The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.:A system, often of numbered categories, used for representation of data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A person acting as a channel for communication on behalf of a group.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A person acting as a channel for communication between groups or on behalf of a group.

Property.preferredDefinition: The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.:A system, often of numbered categories, used for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/7/11 - no longer used by BRIDG; released for reuse by COPPA

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that represents the responsibility of the investigator on a particular study.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Principal Investigator Clinical Study Responsible Person

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Principal Investigator Clinical Study Responsible Person
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. : A person worthy of responsibility or trust or one held accountable.

Concepts.definition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
A person worthy of responsibility or trust or one held accountable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A person acting as a channel for communication between groups or on behalf of a group.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
A person acting as a channel for communication between groups or on behalf of a group.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it; the activities undertaken during a study.: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.

Concepts.definition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.
